summary: Aconcagua is the tallest mountain in the Americas and outside Asia, located in Argentina's Mendoza Province. It stands at 6,961 meters (22,838 feet) and is part of the Andes mountain range. Despite its height, it's only the 189th tallest mountain globally. The mountain is surrounded by the Valle de las Vacas and Valle de los Horcones Inferior, within Aconcagua Provincial Park. It has several glaciers, with the largest, Ventisquero Horcones Inferior, being about 10 km (6 miles) long. The Polish Glacier, a northeastern route, is the most popular ascent path.
title: Aconcagua
